form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Donnelly (for himself and Mr. Boozman) submitted the following concurrent resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

form.official-title: Supporting the designation of the year of 2015 as the International Year of Soils and supporting locally led soil conservation.

whereas.text: Whereas many of the international partners of the United States are designating 2015 as the International Year of Soils;
Whereas soil is vitally important for food security and essential ecosystem functions;
Whereas soil conservation efforts in the United States are often locally led;
Whereas 2015 also marks the 80th anniversary of the signing of the Soil Conservation and Domestic Allotment Act (16 U.S.C. 590a et seq.) on April 27, 1935;
Whereas soils, as the foundation for agricultural production, essential ecosystem functions, and food security, are key to sustaining life on Earth;
Whereas soils and the science of soils contribute to improved water quality, food safety and security, healthy ecosystems, and human health; and
Whereas soil, plant, animal, and human health are intricately linked: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: supports the designation of 2015 as the International Year of Soils;
encourages the public to participate in activities that celebrate the importance of soils to the current and future well-being of the United States; and
supports conservation of the soils of the United States, through—

subparagraph.text: partnership with local soil and water conservation districts; and

clause.text: the conservation reserve program established under subchapter B of chapter 1 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3831 et seq.);
the environmental quality incentives program established under chapter 4 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3839aa et seq.);
the conservation stewardship program established under subchapter B of chapter 2 of subtitle D of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3838D et seq.);
the agricultural conservation easement program established under subtitle H of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3865 et seq.);
the regional conservation partnership program established under subtitle I of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3871 et seq.); and
the small watershed rehabilitation program established under section 14 of the Watershed Protection and Flood Prevention Act (16 U.S.C. 1012).
